question: [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/calculate.move] [Function: dynamic_health_factor()] [Division by Zero] If dynamic_health_loan_value returns 0 but user has actual borrows that haven't been indexed yet, can an attacker exploit the address::max() return to bypass liquidation when they should be liquidatable? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/calculate.move] [Function: dynamic_health_factor()] [Arithmetic Overflow] When ray_math::ray_div(dynamic_health_collateral_value, dynamic_health_loan_value) is called with very large collateral values, can this overflow the u256 type and wrap around to produce an artificially low health factor? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/calculate.move] [Function: dynamic_health_factor()] [Logic Error] The assertion at line 24 prevents both estimate_supply_value > 0 AND estimate_borrow_value > 0, but what if a user wants to simultaneously supply and borrow in a single transaction - does this block legitimate use cases? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/calculate.move] [Function: dynamic_health_factor()] [Integer Conversion] When converting estimate_supply_value from u64 to u256 at line 41, if estimate_supply_value is at u64::MAX, could this cause issues in subsequent ray_mul operations? (Medium)

(Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/calculate.move] [Function: dynamic_health_factor()] [Oracle Manipulation] If the oracle used in dynamic_user_health_collateral_value is manipulated to show inflated collateral prices, can an attacker borrow more than they should based on the inflated health factor? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/calculate.move] [Function: dynamic_health_factor()] [State Inconsistency] If storage is mutated between the calls to dynamic_user_health_collateral_value (line 35) and dynamic_health_loan_value (line 45), can the health factor be calculated on inconsistent state? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/calculate.move] [Function: dynamic_health_factor()] [Edge Case] If dynamic_liquidation_threshold returns 0 because collateral_value is 0 in that function, the health factor becomes 0 regardless of loan value - can this incorrectly trigger liquidations? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/calculate.move] [Function: dynamic_health_factor()] [Logic Bypass] If is_increase is set to false for a supply estimate, and the user's balance is less than estimate_value, can the subtraction at line 190 underflow and cause incorrect health calculations? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/calculate.move] [Function: dynamic_health_factor()] [Type Safety] Since pool is typed as Pool<CoinType> but asset is just u8, can there be a mismatch where the pool type doesn't match the asset being estimated? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/calculate.move] [Function: dynamic_health_factor()] [Return Value Manipulation] When dynamic_health_loan_value is 0, returning address::max() (line 69) represents infinite health - can this be exploited in liquidation logic that uses health factor thresholds?
